Posts.Content: pjwoodin wrote: Hi Ladies, I am so scared and in shock.  I am 50 years young and just diagnosed with TNBC stage IV with liver mets.  I am only 18 months out of chemo for Stage IIb TNBC and now this. I'm hearing really bad things about survival rates and am hoping that this group will give me some hope.  I have a strong faith in God and he is giving me some peace, but am still having a hard time.  Any great survival stories would be very helpful and anything else that got you all through this.  Thanks Dx 2/7/2012, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed pjwoodin pq2

Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed pjwoodin pq2

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2012 08:48AM pjwoodin wrote: Thanks everyone for the replys.  I am heading down to Boston tomorrow to Dana Farber Cancer Institute.  Already had my second opinion there.  I am hoping to qualify for a clinical trial that has a backbone of Taxol and Avastin along with a "mystery drug" that is the trial piece.  I was refered there, and have confidence in all of the specialist there.  They have 30 breast oncologists on staff.  It will require weekly trips to Boston (3 hours from my home) but I feel that this is a good option for me.  I have no idea how I will deal with chemo every week?  Will it shrink these mets and lymph nodes? Will I have no life because I'll be so sick with the chemo?  Just a few fears that I thought I'd write about.  This is so overwhelming.  I really thought I would beat this when it was Stage IIb.  Guess that wasn't my path - this new journey is not one I signed up for!  Pat
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed pjwoodin pq2
